item.title: ssh preventing timeouts
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: Preventing SSH Timeouts

Revision History:
    2015-03-11 18:33:59 - Version 1 created by Paul Rigor

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)

 Some environments require short timeouts to minimize the vulnerable time a server is open via SSH and a user leave thier computer insecure.   This work around should only be used when you have time intensive tasks AND your terminal secured at all times.

 There are two ways to prevent these timeouts.

 1) in ~/.ssh/config add the following:

 Host *
    ServerAliveInterval=15

2) In iterm, navigate to preferences -> Profiles -> Select the profile you are using -> Session -> Select 'When idle, send ASCII code: 0'

Either will prevent the timeouts.

*IMPORTANT*

If you use the ctac_vpn_manage process with Viscosity.  be sure to log into the VPN account where the timeout occurs as the ssh config file is one of the managed files.

https://bitbucket.org/CTACSYSADMIN/ctac_vpn_manage
